name: TRANSPLANT_ORG_ECS
description: This table contains information about a transplant patient's willingness to accept organs from donors meeting various criteria. Each line represents a change in the documentation about the patient's willingness to accept organs from donors meeting various criteria.

columns.name: SUMMARY_BLOCK_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the episode of care record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: Each line identifies a change to the type organ accepted selection.

columns.name: TX_HCV_YN
columns.description: Whether or not the patient will accept an hepatitis C (HCV) positive organ.

columns.name: TX_HBV_YN
columns.description: Whether or not the patient will accept a hepatitis B (HBV) positive organ.

columns.name: TX_ECD_YN
columns.description: Whether or not the patient will accept an organ from an expanded criteria donor.

columns.name: TX_ECD_UPD_USER_ID
columns.description: The user who updated patient's donor criteria.

columns.name: TX_ECD_UPD_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: TX_ECD_UPD_INST
columns.description: The instant when patient's donor criteria were documented.

columns.name: TX_HCV_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason for accepting or not accepting an organ from a hepatitis C (HCV) positive donor. This category number is usually the same as the internal ID. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Community ID (CID).

columns.name: TX_HBV_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason for accepting or not accepting an organ from a hepatitis B (HBV) positive donor. This category number is usually the same as the internal ID. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Community ID (CID).

columns.name: TX_ECD_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason for accepting or not accepting an organ from an expanded criteria donor. This category number is usually the same as the internal ID. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Community ID (CID).

columns.name: TX_DOC_VERIFIER_ID
columns.description: User who verifies the donor organ criteria

columns.name: TX_DOC_VERIFIER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: TX_DOC_VERIFY_INST
columns.description: Date the donor organ criteria was verified

columns.name: TX_CROSSMATCH_YN
columns.description: Does transplant require a crossmatch

columns.name: TX_XMATCH_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason the organ does or does not need crossmatch testing performed. This category number is usually the same as the internal ID. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Community ID (CID).

columns.name: TX_ANTIGENS_YN
columns.description: Does the transplant have unacceptable antigens

columns.name: TX_ANTIGEN_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason for the patient's unacceptable antigens. This category number is usually the same as the internal ID. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Community ID (CID).

columns.name: TX_DCD_YN
columns.description: Whether the recipient will accept an organ from a donor who died from cardiac death.

columns.name: TX_DCD_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The reason for accepting or not accepting a donation after cardiac death.

columns.name: MIN_DNR_WEIGHT
columns.description: Minimum acceptable donor weight

columns.name: MAX_DNR_WEIGHT
columns.description: Maximum acceptable donor weight

columns.name: CDC_HIGH_RISK_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the patient will accept an organ from a donor that has risk factors for blood-borne disease transmission.

columns.name: CDC_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The reason a patient will or will not accept an organ from a donor that has risk factors for blood-borne disease transmission.

columns.name: SEGMENTAL_LIVER_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the patient will accept a segmental liver from a donor.

columns.name: SEG_LVR_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The reason a patient will or will not accept a segmental liver as a donor organ.
